decorations: a single red ruby
a single green emerald
a single blue topaz
a single tigers eye
mother of pearl inlay
a detailed inlay of vines and flowers
indecipherable runes
a crystal that drips blood
a small flower that blooms in sunlight
a cloudy gem that shows a foggy scene of the last wielders death
a grip that stains wielder's hands dark green
hidden, detachable throwing knife in the grip
soft glowing lights that can only be seen in total darkness
a peacock feather that unfurls during combat
rose thorns that drink blood
exotic furs flaps that cover the hands of the wielder
glowing mushrooms...maybe poisonous
soft moss that absorbs sweat and gives a comfortable grip
blurry map of the area engraved into the weapon
a blinking eyeball that always looks at whatever thing is closest to death
bright colorful tassles
spiderwebs that spread quickly and must be regularly cleaned off
an ever burning flame; this weapon cannot be stored or stowed safely
a thin crack; tiny eyes can sometimes be seen peering out
the illusion of flames; soft warm light but no heat
a bright moonlight glow that attracts nearby insects
the names of past wielders...it seems never ending
a warm grip; warm enough to combat a chill and make a nice day uncomfortable
squeaky leather grip; it creaks and makes noise at the worst times
bandages; they can be torn off and used to patch wounds, and will regrow over time
a large crystal that drips water; just enough water to keep a person alive but miserable
clear scales that slowly absorb and reflect the color of their surroundings
a grip that pulses as if breathing, during combat the pulse races
etchings of a terrible creature, and instructions on where to find it
instructions for a dark spell that requires the destruction of the weapon itself
a small button that shifts the weapon to another, random form (use the roller to determine the type). This button can only be pressed once a day
a worn leather grip that’s been molded to the previous wielder, makes it very difficult to let go
thin green vines that keep growing and must be pruned every morning
gaudy gems that look fake and tacky
three blue sapphires placed in a triangle
the previous wielder’s name embossed under the thin grip, pressing into your hand as an uncomfortable reminder
a thin opal line that seems to glow at very random and sometimes inconvenient moments.
a built-in flask filled with aged liquor
awkard cube-shaped grip
an awkwardly short grip
etchings of waves that ebb and flow along with the real-world tides
the blue-orange-yellow of fresh tempered steel
strange engravings that channel the sweat into a small resevoir at the bottom of the weapon. If the resevoir isn't emptied every night the weapon becomes heavy and awkward.
rapidly growing hair; must be cut every few days.
a long spike, perfect for bashing anything that gets too close
a reflection from another place, the light and images you see in the metal do not match your surroundings
a thick guard to protect your hands
hinges so the weapon can fold to a smaller size
a detailed etching of a lizard that blinks occasionally
dark runes that slowly begin to spread across the Wielder's skin
Delicate vine that grows a silver grape-sized fruit; tastes delicious
wings of some kind; they flutter occasionally
small legs that occasionally extend and try to skitter away
tiny gears that click and clack whenever the weapon is swung
thick reptilian skin that molts every few days
a grip that grows and shrinks with the weather
a sharkskin grip that will cut up your palms if not held in the right way
engraved letters of a message; the message changes every few days and seems to be coming from someone who is in dire trouble
a small compass that doesn't point north.
a collection of small retractable tools including: pocket knife, fork, spoon, tweezers, nail file, and probably some you missed
engraved instructions explaining how to care for the weapon; they are complex and ridiculous

Several bottles of strong, fast-drying dye in a variety of bright colours [src]

Wooden Spoon. Carved with rune for "food". When tapped on an inert organic or semi-organic material (wood, dirt) it turns that stuff into edible foodstuffs, although it will be mushy and unpalatable. [src]

Amulet of Hope. Shines as bright as a candle, but only when there are no other light sources. Light points back towards dungeon entrance, vaguely. Hums reassuringly when clutched, and warms your hand. [src]
Orphan's Top. Cannot be spun if there are any invisible undead nearby. [src]

Ring of the Adventurous Limb. If worn on a hand, the entire arm will vanish. It will return after 24 hours have elapsed. Roll a d10: 1 - tattoo on arm, 2 - arm injured, 3 - gained a ring, probably a wedding ring, 4 - ring missing, 5-10 - nothing special. It will have a similar effect on legs. [src]

Dust of De-Appearance. Can make things invisible, but wears off if the object moves, is moved, or even wiggles a bit. Best used on inanimate objects or people who can hold really, really, still. [src]
Paired Scrolls. Whatever is written on one appears on the other. Give players a 3"x5" card to write on, to limit how much they can write. [src]

Statuette of Baal. Can be "fed" gold to grow larger, adding to its. Starts out the size of a gold coin. Becomes more complex as it grows larger, adds features and companions. If grown to the size of 100,000 gp, golden tablet reveals great secret. (Does not create or destroy gold, just absorbs it.) If grown to 1,000,000 gp, it will come alive and try to take over the world. [src]
Book of Epic Boredom. When reading, save vs sleep. [src]
Black Cigarette. When smoked, it creates a huge cloud of smoke and allows the smoker to see through smoke and fog. Can be smoked for 5 minutes (or 5 one-minute segments). [src]

Colorthief's Brush. This paintbrush has a needle on the back. If you prick something, you steal all the color from it, but can later paint with those same brilliant colors (stored in the brush, controlled by imagination). If a book is pricked, it will steal the words. The book can then be reconstructed, but it takes a few days of writing for it to be recovered. [src]
Sleeping Draught. Sleep TWICE AS HARD for four hours. You get a full night's rest, but cannot be woken up. Unwilling targets get a save. [src]
Love Potion. [src]
Exploserous Carnelian. When activated, begins to glow hotter and hotter. Explodes like a stick of dynamite after 1d2+2 rounds. [src]
Mighty Acorn. When thrown on the ground, immediately grows into a 20' oak. [src]

Mechanical Torchbearer. Follows the associated amulet, or whoever is wearing it. Can hold 6 torches, and relight a new one as the old one burns out. Looks like a mechanical spider, 5' in diameter. [src]

Penguin tokens (1d6). Summons an 80 lb emperor penguin. On land, cannot do anything except waddle to where you direct. In water, can attack as a 1 HD creature. Is destroyed/killed if it takes any damage. Reverts to a small (1") wooden token after 1 minute. [src]
Saint's Bones. About the size of a cigar box. Contains mandible + some carpals. Will rattle ominously when a lie is uttered nearby. [src]
Amber Comb. Any lightning attack within 10' is diverted to the comb instead. If the comb takes 6 or more damage (it is not immune to lightning), it shatters. [src]
Chewed Bone. When chewed, it fills the air with the smell of delicious fresh meat. This is strong enough to mask other odors. [src]

Bottle of Light. When swung overhead (a small chain is attached for this purpose) the bottle absorbs ambient light. Later, the bottle can be unstoppered to allow the light back out again. Can hold up to 5 rounds of light. Special properties of light are preserved: moonlight can induce lycanthropy, for example. [src]
Silver silk handkerchief. 3' on a side. On the command word, it becomes as hard as thick steel. A second command word reverts. [src]
Silver silk rope. As above, except a rope. 25'. [src]

Goggles of the Clown. When worn, everything looks like a clown, and speaks in a mocking, clowning voice. It is very difficult to tell people apart. You can barely tell a knight apart from his horse (which appears as a four-legged clown). In combat, you must make a Wisdom check every round or lose track of which clown is which. On the upside, you are immune to the beauty of nymphs and the ugliness of catoblepas. [src]

Vial of Nightshade. When drunk, it puts the body into a deep coma and ejects the spirit. You can now roam around, incorporeal, until you return to your body. There is a 1-in-6 chance each hour that some mishap befalls you (body possessed by outsider, soul lost forever, etc). Coma lasts for 1d3 days. [src]

Grinning Amulet. Anyone who laughs--even a snicker--near this amulet must make a save or laugh uncontrollably for the next minute. Careful, it's contagious--if a player laughs during this, so does their character. [src]
Trollwax. Tacky and unpalatable. Anything that tastes it must succeed on a check, or be so disgusted that it cannot taste it again. (Takes a week to fully leave the tongue.) [src]
Cheater's Coin. When flipped, it will give whatever result the owner wishes. This is not limited to heads/tails--it can also give results of king, dragon, treasury, pilgrims, etc. [src]

Boots of Independence. When you remove these boots and fail to restrain them (put them in a pack, etc) they will walk back the way they came, all the way back to where you first put them on, with more-or-less the same cadence and sounds. If you walked in a loop somewhere along the line, the boots will get stuck in the loop and repeat. [src]

Tiny tree. Produces three fat apples every day (enough to feed 1 person). Must be watered with 1 cup of blood each day, or it will die. If dead, can be revived with water. Probably found dead/in a chest. [src]

Skeleton gourd. This gourd has a peephole. Anyone holding the gourd up to their face and looking into the peephole will be paralyzed while their brain is filled with visions of dancing skeletons. [src]
Ring of Petrification. Putting this ring on will turn a person to stone, except for the ring. Someone else can remove the ring, and thereby return them to flesh. [src]

Party Book. This book creates audible illusions imitating a party. The state of the party depends on the page the book is opened to. If the book is turned to page 1, you'll hear a couple people setting up silverware. Middle of the book, raucous carousing. Near the end, mostly snores and a few people taking shots. [src]
Quiet Bell. This 2" tall silver bell prevents all sound within 1'. [src]

Palette of All Colors. Contains 7 mundane palettes (ROYGBIV) and 1 color that is invisible to humans. If the invisible color is painted on a wall, it allows people to see through it. Can paint up to a 3' diameter spot, or 10 3" peepholes. Penetrates no more than 6". Getting it on someone's face blinds them. [src]
Slimming Cone. When touched to a creature, it instantly and harmless sucks out all the excess fat from them, ejecting it onto the floor in a big mass. [src]
Grass Whistle. When blown, roll for a random encounter. If the location has no encounter table (some cities, maybe), the PCs will meet someone interesting who wants something. [src]
Naiad-hair Ring. 50% cursed. When worn, PC treats all water as if it had the consistency of a gas. (Don't fall off a boat.) Water is still unbreathable. [src]
Ring of Swimming. Wearer treats air as if it had the consistency of water. You can "fly" by swimming through the air, but the air is too thick to breath. Other water penalties also apply. [src]
Belt of Cat Imprisonment. When laid on the ground, felines are compelled to sit in the center of it. As charm. [src]
Endless Boots. Cannot stop walking. Will never tire from walking. Cannot run. Walk walk walk. [src]

Spike of Woodland Suicides. Sort of like a hunter's trap. When left in the woods, wild animals will come and impale themselves on it. A verdant forest yield 1d10 rations worth per day, but must be moved daily. Fey will hate you, though. [src]
Salt Block. Any food you carry will never spoil. Doesn't have to be on your person. Applies to a captain and his ship's cargo, for example. [src]
Log of Alarum. This 300 lb log protects those who sleep with their heads against it. If they would be attacked in their sleep, the log has a 90% chance of waking them up (by making bird song). [src]
Demonic Muffin. When eaten, reverses your gravity for 1d6 minutes. [src]
Everice. Never melts. [src]
Chest of the Mundane. Anything placed inside it is covered with an illusion that makes it look worthless and boring. Currently holding 3 peridots worth 10gp each. [src]

Boots of Devouring. Cursed. As soon as you put one on your foot it starts eating you like a garbage disposal. Feeding it lots of booze causes it to vomit out everything in its stomache (which may include some treasure). [src]

Fox-in-a-Bag. Sleeps all the time. As soon as it touches the ground, it will run around like crazy. Dex 18, AC as plate because of high Dexterity + foxy nature. If you pick it up (good luck) it will fall back asleep. [src]

Feather of Bravado. When placed in a hat, it points in the direction of the nearest deadly foe capable of killing the PCs. When placed in the bottom of one's shoe, allows them to run slightly faster. [src]

Gossip Cookies. Each one contains either a random rumor from the most relevant rumor table or "You will be killed by [random monster from most relevant random encounter table]". 50% chance of each. [src]

A small silver figurine that, when given away, will return to your pocket after 1d6 minutes. The only way to permanently get rid of it is for the recipient to similarly give it away before the 1d6 minutes expire. (Alternatively, the original owner could die.) Yes, this is great for scamming people. Apparent value: 1d100 silver. [src]
A rock that, when thrown, always hits its target. Always. Cannot do anything that you couldn't conceivably do with a really lucky throw. [src]
A saddle that turns any animal into a horse when it is strapped on. The horse cannot remove the saddle on its own. [src]
A key that can unlock any door, but cannot be removed from the mechanism until the door is relocked. [src]
A mug that points the way to the nearest tavern when it is balanced on its edge. [src]
An egg cup that can hatch any egg that is placed atop it. [src]
A ring that gives the wearer a magnificent mustache/beard, depending on which finger it is worn on. The left ring finger, for example, always yields a Van Dyke. [src]
A ring that makes your eyeball pop out. This is not a problem, and you can continue to see through the eye just fine, like a spy-eye. Reversible if the ring is removed. [src]
A ring that makes you invisible, but not your equipment or clothing. [src]
An umbrella that allows you float downwards at 60'/round when open, negating fall damage. [src]
Chicken Arrows (1d6). On a hit, target must save vs fear (first arrow only). If sat upon like an egg, quickly turns into an adult chicken. Fletched with white feathers. [src]
Bag of Infinite Manure. Useful for campfires. [src]

Wand of Necromantic Cooking. Can enchant a corpse or cut of meat to cut, prepare, marinate, and cook itself. A slaughtered pig will seek out gravy to roll around in. Sausages will jump into the saucepan, and then seek out your plate when cooked. [src]
Omnidress. Can turn into any type of dress (can even imitate leather armor, but not metal). [src]
Indelible Pen. Can write on anything. Writing is permanent. Works 1d6 times. [src]
Ring that makes the wearer appear to be dead and rotten. [src]
Scones (1d6). When broken in half, it erupts into 1d100 scones (10 scones = food for a day). Alternatively, it can be eaten to restore 1d6 HP. [src]
Wooden hand. 1/day, can turn into a living-but-disembodied hand for 1 hour. Will obey your commands for the duration. Str 1, can climb most walls. Int 6, can see normally, but cannot speak. [src]
Locket. Woman's face inside the amulet always looks towards Meltheria. [src]
Box of paired snails. When one snail dies, so does its mate. Normally used to send very crude, binary messages. There are 1d6 pairs of snails. Feed them leaves. [src]
Hungry coin. Cursed. Will attempt to eat other coins that it comes into contact with. Eats 100 coins an hour. [src]
Armor of Glamour. Looks like a fancy dinner suit. Is actually a suit of plate mail. [src]
Ring of Good Omen. The first time you fail a save against a curse or other magic, the ring breaks and you instead make your save. [src]
Prayer of the Seal. When this sheet of paper is attached to a door or portal, it become locked (until the paper is removed or destroyed.) [src]
Boots of the Aristocrat. When you click them together, your clothes become clean, your skin becomes perfumed, and your hair is styled. [src]
Cursed matches (1d6). When lit, the match does not ignite. Instead, whatever the PC is looking at catches fire. (Tiny match-sized fire. Does no damage unless allowed to progress.) [src]
Preservative jar. Anything placed in this jar enters stasis. Cannot hold anything bigger than a toad. Currently holds a toad. [src]
Library Box. When a non-magical book is placed inside it, another of the same type will be found there the next day. [src]

Monocle of Entropy. If you stare at something long enough, it will fall over. 1 round for a candlestick, 1 minute for a sleeping cow, 1 hour for a small tree, 1 day for a cottage or large tree, 1 week for a castle. Must be within 100'. [src]
Girdle of Masculinity/Femininity. Non-cursed because that's way more fun. [src]
Stick of the Titan. Hits for 2d8, then breaks. [src]
Singing frog. Knows 1d6 songs. Good for a free round of drinks in pretty much any bar you walk in to, with only a 20% chance that someone will try to steal it from you at the end of the night. [src]
Perpetual motion machine. Utterly unremarkable in a world filled with magic, but still cool. [src]

Seed of Moon Ice. If dropped in a body of water, will "freeze" an area up to 20' diameter. If swallowed, you die. If touched, save or die. Leaves awesomely frozen corpses that are not cold to the touch and never thaw. [src]
Small broom. When activated, will attempt to clean the dirtiest thing nearby. [src]
Black cat, winged. When you tap it on the nose, it enters stasis. (This is why you found it in a treasure chest.) [src]
Blindfold of the Spirits. When worn, you can attack incorporeal things as if they weren't. Also, you're blind. [src]

Night's Black Windchimes. 25% chance of alerting you when you would be attacked during the night. If one of the 1d6+1 chimes is broken in half, a refreshing (but also quite cold) breeze blows through the area. [src]
Dust of Vermicide. When thrown, does 1 damage to everything in a 5' diameter area. Alternatively, does 2d6 damage against a swarm. [src]
Sovereign Glue. [src]
Universal Solvent. [src]
Goblin cloak. Invisible while in shadowy areas, but stinks like a mound of goblin waste. [src]

Miser's Flute. When played, all unsecured coins in 20' will leap up and roll after you. They will follow you as long as you play, and as fast as normal running speed. Uphill is fine, stairs are not. [src]

Donkey Legs. These wooden donkey legs can be attached to anything (but are not strong enough to carry literally anything). Once attached, the thing will follow you around like a loyal donkey. For example, you can attach them to a heavy statue and then have it walk itself out of the dungeon. Donkey legs are as strong as two donkeys! [src]
Giant's Ochre. Anything painted with this pigment will double in size. Washes off easily with water or sweat. (If you paint yourself, it'll wash off after 1d6 rounds of sweaty combat). [src]
Mask of the Jester. Anyone seeing it for the first time must save vs charm or be compelled to attack the wearer. [src]

Eye of Zin. If this jewel is pressed into the forehead, the wearer's eyes turn jet black, they gain darkvision, and they are blinded by even small amounts of light (a nearby torch will blind them, for example). [src]

Metal Eye Mask. Wearing this mask obscures you normal vision, but allows you to see from above, sort of like an orbital satellite's view. At sea level, you can see an area 200' in diameter, centered on the mask. [src]

Pink Bead. When smashed on the ground, immediately turns into a huge mountain of fluffy bubbles, similar in consistency to a mass of fused marshmallows. Can cushion a fall or block a hallway or something. 10' in diameter, can be cut through with 6 slashing attacks, lasts 1d6 minutes. [src]
Animate rope with the personality of a loyal dog. 50'. Must be taught knots the way a dog must be taught tricks. [src]
Spells: Adhere. Object is covered in extremely sticky slime.
Animate Object. Object obeys your commands as best it can. It can walk 15ft per round.
Anthropomorphize. A touched animal either gains human intelligence or human appearance for L days.
Arcane Eye. You can see through a magical floating eyeball that flies around at your command.
Astral Prison. An object is frozen in time and space within an invulnerable crystal shell.
Attract. L+1 objects are strongly magnetically attracted to each other if they come within 10 feet.
Auditory Illusion. You create illusory sounds that seem to come from a direction of your choice.
Babble. A creature must loudly and clearly repeat everything you think. It is otherwise mute.
Beast Form. You and your possessions transform into a mundane animal.
Befuddle. L creatures of your choice are unable to form new short-term memories for the duration of the spell.
Bend Fate. Roll L+1 d20s. Whenever you must roll a d20 after casting the spell, you must choose and then discard one of the rolled results until they are all gone.
Bird Person. Your arms turn into huge bird wings.
Body Swap. You switch bodies with a creature you touch. If one body dies, the other dies as well.
Charm. L creatures treat you like a friend.
Command. A creature obeys a single, three-word command that does not harm it.
Comprehend. You become fluent in all languages.
Control Plants. Nearby plants and trees obey you and gain the ability to move at 5 feet per round.
Control Weather. You may alter the type of weather at will, but you do not otherwise control it.

Counterspell. Make an opposed Intelligence save against the Intelligence of the caster of a nearby spell. You may do this out of turn as a reaction, or against an ongoing magical effect. On a success, you may cancel the spell.
Deafen. All nearby creatures are deafened.
Detect Magic. You hear nearby magical auras singing. Volume and harmony signify the aura’s power and refinement.
Disassemble. Any of your body parts may be detached and reattached at will, without causing pain or damage. You can still control them.
Disguise. You may alter the appearance of L characters at will as long as they remain humanoid. Attempts to duplicate other characters will seem uncanny.
Displace. An object appears to be up to L×10ft from its actual position.
Earthquake. The ground begins shaking violently. Structures may be damaged or collapse.
Elasticity. Your body can stretch up to L×10ft.
Elemental Wall. A straight wall of ice or fire L×40ft long and 10ft high rises from the ground.
Filch. L visible items teleport to your hands.
Fog Cloud. Dense fog spreads out from you.
Frenzy. L creatures erupt in a frenzy of violence.
Gate. A portal to a random plane opens.
Gravity Shift. You can change the direction of gravity (for yourself only) up to once per round.
Greed. L creatures develop an overwhelming urge to possess a visible item of your choice.
Haste. Your movement speed is tripled.
Hatred. L creatures develop a deep hatred of another creature or group of creatures and wish to destroy it.
Hear Whispers. You can hear faint sounds clearly.
Hover. An object hovers, frictionless, 2ft above the ground. It can hold up to L humanoids.
Hypnotize. A creature enters a trance and will truthfully answer L yes or no questions you ask it.
Icy Touch. A thick ice layer spreads across a touched surface, up to L×10ft in radius.
Illuminate. A floating light moves as you command.
Increase Gravity. The gravity in an area triples.
Invisible Tether. Two objects within 10ft of each other cannot be moved more than 10ft apart.
Knock. L nearby mundane or magical locks unlock.
Leap. You can jump up to L×10ft in the air.
Liquid Air. The air around you becomes swimmable.
Magic Dampener. All nearby magical effects have their effectiveness halved.
Manse. A sturdy, furnished cottage appears for L×12 hours. You can permit and forbid entry to it at will.
Marble Madness. Your pockets are full of marbles, and will refill every round.
Masquerade. L characters’ appearances and voices become identical to a touched character.
Miniaturize. You and L other touched creatures are reduced to the size of a mouse.
Mirror Image. L illusory duplicates of yourself appear under your control.
Mirrorwalk. A mirror becomes a gateway to another mirror that you looked into today.
Multiarm. You gain L extra arms.
Night Sphere. An L×40ft wide sphere of darkness displaying the night sky appears.
Objectify. You become any inanimate object between the size of a grand piano and an apple.
Ooze Form. You become a living jelly.
Pacify. L creatures have an aversion to violence.
Phantom Coach. A ghostly coach appears until end of spell. It moves unnaturally fast over any terrain, including water.
Phobia. L creatures become terrified of an object of your choice.
Pit. A pit 10ft wide and L×5ft deep opens in the ground.
Primeval Surge. An object grows to the size of an elephant. If it is an animal, it is enraged.
Psychometry. The referee answers L yes or no questions about a touched object.
Pull. An object of any size is pulled directly towards you with the strength of L men for one round.
Push. An object of any size is pushed directly away from you with the strength of L men for one round.
Raise Dead. L skeletons rise from the ground to serve you. They are incredibly stupid and can only obey simple orders.
Raise Spirit. The spirit of a dead body manifests and will answer L questions.
Read Mind. You can hear the surface thoughts of nearby creatures.
Repel. L+1 objects are strongly magnetically repelled from each other if they come within 10 feet.
Scry. You can see through the eyes of a creature you touched earlier today.
Sculpt Elements. All inanimate material behaves like clay in your hands.
Shroud. L creatures are invisible until they move.
Shuffle. L creatures instantly switch places. Determine where they end up randomly.
Sleep. L creatures fall into a light sleep.
Smoke Form. Your body becomes living smoke.

Snail Knight. 10 minutes after casting, a knight sitting astride a giant snail rides into view. He is able to answer most questions related to quests and chivalry, and may aid you if he finds you worthy.
Sniff. You can smell even the faintest traces of scents.
Sort. Inanimate items sort themselves according to categories you set. The categories must be visually verifiable.
Spectacle. A clearly unreal but impressive illusion of your choice appears, under your control. It may be up to the size of a palace and has full motion and sound.
Spellseize. Cast this as a reaction to another spell going off to make a temporary copy of it that you can cast at any time before this spell ends.
Spider Climb. You can climb surfaces like a spider.
Summon Cube. Once per second, (6 times per round) you may summon or banish a 3-foot-wide cube of earth. New cubes must be affixed to the earth or to other cubes.
Swarm. You become a swarm of crows, rats, or piranhas. You only take damage from area effects.
Telekinesis. You may mentally move L items.
Telepathy. L+1 creatures can hear each other’s thoughts, no matter how far apart they move.
Teleport. An object disappears and reappears on the ground in a visible, clear area up to L×40ft away.
Thaumaturgic Anchor. Object becomes the target of every spell cast near it.
Thicket. A thicket of trees and dense brush up to L×40ft wide suddenly sprouts up.
Time Jump. An object disappears as it jumps L×10 minutes into the future. When it returns, it appears in the unoccupied area nearest to where it left.
Summon Idol. A carved stone statue the size of a four poster bed rises from the ground.
Time Rush. Time in a 40ft bubble starts moving 10 times faster.
Time Slow. Time in a 40ft bubble slows to 10%.
True Sight. You see through all nearby illusions.
Upwell. A spring of seawater appears.
Vision. You completely control what a creature sees.
Visual Illusion. A silent, immobile, illusion of your choice appears, up to the size of a bedroom.
Ward. A silver circle 40ft across appears on the ground. Choose one thing that cannot cross it. Living creatures, dead creatures, projectiles or metal.
Web. Your wrists can shoot thick webbing.
Wizard Mark. Your finger can shoot a stream of ulfire-colored paint. This paint is only visible to you, and can be seen at any distance, even through solid objects.
X-Ray Vision. You gain X-Ray vision.

Absorb Potion, Duration: L hours, Range: touch. The target drinks a potion when the spell is cast. That potion is then suspended within their bloodstream. They can choose to activate it, instantly, at any point during the duration. If they have not done so by the end of the duration, the potion dissolves without effect. [src]
Absorb Toxicity, Duration: L hours, Range: self. You take no damage from poison for the duration. You can pass poison from yourself to creatures you touch. [src]

Absurdity, Duration: 1 minute, Range: 30’. Target saves vs. Charisma; on failure, they consider one thing completely absurd. The caster chooses which things the victim considers absurd. The target does not fear, & cannot be intimidated by, the absurd object. [src]

Acid Fog, Duration: L minutes, Range: 100’. Creates a cloud of fog with radius equal to 5’ times the highest die rolled (up to 30’). The cloud is opaque, and creatures in the cloud take L acid damage per round. [src]
Acute Senses, Duration: L minutes, Range: self. You have the sight of a hawk & the scenting ability of a hound for the duration. [src]
Adhesive Blood, Duration: L minutes, Range: self. Whenever an attack hits you & deals damage, the weapon sticks to your body. The attacker must make a STR save to pry their weapon loose. [src]

Adhesive Spit, Duration: L minutes, Range: self. You can spit up to L times, up to 30’. The target struck saves vs. DEX or is tangled up & can’t move from the spot; they also take -2 to attack rolls. They must save vs. STR or attack the slime with a slashing weapon to free themselves. [src]

Aggravate Thundercloud, Range: 120’. Can only be cast if there are clouds overhead. A bolt of lightning leaps from heaven and strikes the target, dealing 1d6xL lightning damage. They take double damage if wearing metal armour. [src]
Agony, Duration: L rounds, Range: sight. Target experiences wracking pain. They must save each round while afflicted or miss their turn. [src]
Air Bubble, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Creates a bubble of air around the target, allowing them to breathe even in environments that lack oxygen. [src]
Air Step, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Target walks on air L feet above any solid surface. [src]

Alarm, Duration: L hours. Ward a single area up to 1d6xL square feet in size. If any creature enters the area, you instantly know about it. If you so choose, a loud noise can also emanate when the alarm is triggered, heard up to L x 100’ from the area. You can designate up to L creatures who will not set off the alarm. You are automatically excluded. [src]

Allure, Duration: L rounds, Range: sight. Any creature that can see you saves vs. CHA (with penalty equal to L) or is compelled to approach you. If they are hostile, they will approach you with hostile intent. [src]
Ant Haul, Duration: 1 day, Range: touch. Target can carry L x 2 extra equipment slots without being encumbered. [src]
Antimagic Field, Duration: 1 minute, Range: self. The field emanates from you in a radius of 10’. [src]

Anti-Life Shell, Duration: 1 minute, Range: self. Living creatures with Hit Dice equal to or less than L cannot approach within 10’ of you. Creatures already in the shell when the spell is cast are unaffected unless they leave the shell (or you move far enough away from them). [src]
Anti-Undead Shell, Duration: 1 minute, Range: self. Like Anti-Life Shell, but affects the undead instead. [src]
Aphasia, Duration: L minutes, Range: 120’. Target saves with penalty equal to L. On failure, they cannot speak or comprehend any language, written or spoken, for the duration. [src]

Aqueous Orb, Duration: L rounds, Range: 60’. Conjure an orb of water about 6’ in radius. If you spend your turn concentrating, you can cause it to move up to 30’ in a direction of your choosing. It rolls along the ground - it can’t float. Anything smaller than the sphere in its path is caught up inside; creatures can save vs. DEX to avoid it or to escape. [src]
Atavism, Duration: L minutes, Range: 10’. Target animal reverts to a primeval, frenzied state; it gets +4 to all saving throws & attack rolls, & +2 to damage rolls. [src]

Aura of Doom, Duration: L rounds, Range: self. You exude an aura of terror. Creatures within 15’ of you save vs. CHA (with a penalty equal to L) or are terrified of you (they roll Morale immediately). [src]

Aversion, Duration: 1 day, Range: sight. Target saves vs. CHA (with a penalty equal to L) or becomes profoundly averse to an object or location of your choice. The object can’t be something they’re currently holding or touching. [src]

Babbling Curse, Duration: L minutes, Range: 30’. Target saves vs. CHA (with a penalty equal to L) or starts babbling incoherently and uncontrollably. Anyone hearing the babbling saves or becomes fascinated & unable to focus on anything else. Attacking the victim, or a fascinated creature, ends the spell prematurely. [src]
Bane Weapon, Duration: L rounds, Range: touch. Touch the weapon and name a creature. The weapon 1d6 extra damage to that creature for the duration. [src]
Banishment, Range: 120’. The target must be an extra-planar creature with Hit Dice equal to 1d6xL or less. They are instantly returned to their home plane and can’t be re-summoned for 24 hours. [src]

Barrier of Force, Duration: L rounds, Range: touch. A barrier of force surrounds the target. Nothing (except for air) can pass inward through the barrier, though anything can pass outward. The barrier can be attacked; it breaks when 1d6xL points of damage are dealt to it. [src]
Battering Wind, Range: 60’ + 10’ x L. Target saves or is thrown back 10’ per L. You can affect 1 target per L, so long as they’re fairly close together. [src]
Bestial Speech, Duration: L hours, Range: self. You can communicate with animals for the duration. [src]

Black Tentancles, Duration: L rounds, Range: 60’. Black tentacles surge from the ground. Affects one 5’ square per L. Victims must save vs. STR to escape, with a penalty equal to L, and the tentacles deal 1d6 damage to each victim per round. [src]
Blight, Range: self. Plants in a radius of 1/2 mile per L wither and die at your touch. [src]
Blindness, Duration: permanent, Range: touch. Target is cursed with magical blindness. [src]
Blink, Range: 10’ x L. You teleport in a straight line to a point you can see. You can’t move through solid obstacles. [src]

Blood Tentacles, Duration: L minutes, Range: self. Smear blood across your chest; L blood tentacles burst forth. They can be used to attack any creature within 15’ for 1d6 damage; on hit, the tentacle is destroyed, and you regain hp equal to damage dealt. [src]

Burning Gaze, Duration: L rounds, Range: self. Anything you look at for the duration catches on fire, if human-sized or smaller. For each invested die past 4, double the maximum size of affected objects. [src]
Cacophony, Duration: Lx2 rounds, Range: 120’. A deafening cacophony fills an area up to L x 10’ in diameter. Nobody can hear each other speak. Spellcasters must save or fumble spellcasting. [src]
Call Object, Range: 10’ x L. Summon an object you’ve touched within the last 10 minutes to your hand. (It must fit in your hand to be eligible.) [src]

Call Vermin, Duration: 1 hour. A swarm of 1d6xL rats or similar vermin are magically called to you from the surrounding area (if there are no such vermin in the vicinity, the spell is useless). They will obey simple spoken commands you issue for the spell’s duration. [src]

Calm. Affects up to 1d6xL HD of creatures in your vicinity. Strong emotions (such as fear, hatred, excitement) are reduced to mildness and relaxation. Creatures may save to resist if they wish (with a penalty equal to L). [src]
Carry Companion, Duration: L hours, Range: touch. A target person or animal turns into a stone statue about 6’’ high. Target must be willing. [src]
Catatonia, Duration: L hours, Range: touch. Target appears, even on close inspection, to be dead. Only magical means can expose the artifice. [src]
Challenge, Duration: L minutes, Range: hearing. The challenged creature is compelled to fight you. If they don’t, they take a -2 penalty to all attack rolls & saving throws. [src]

Charm, Duration: L days, Range: touch. The target saves (with penalty equal to L) or regards you as a trusted friend for the duration. They aren’t aware that they’ve been charmed until the spell wears off. [src]

Clone, Range: touch. A perfect duplicate of the person touched sprouts from their side, rapidly growing into a fully-formed copy. It has HD equal to L or the target’s HD, whichever is lower. The clone is essentially a mindless zombie, but if the target dies, their consciousness is instantly transplanted into the clone. [src]

Cloudkill, Duration: d4 minutes, Range: 120’. Cloud fills a 20’ radius sphere and lingers for 1d4 minutes. Creatures with HD less than L within the cloud are killed instantly. Other creatures are unaffected. [src]

Coldsnap, Range: 30’+30’xL. An area L x 5’ in diameter is exposed to a sudden burst of frigid cold. Creatures in the area take 1d6xL cold damage, water freezes, & so on. The area gradually returns to its normal temperature over the course of an hour. [src]
Colour Spray, Range: 15’ cone [src]

Creatures with HD less than L are are knocked unconscious for 2d4 rounds and blinded for 1d4 rounds after waking. Creatures with HD equal to L are blinded for 1d4 rounds. Creatures with HD greater than L save or are stunned for 1 round. [src]
Command, Duration: 1 round, Range: hearing. Target saves (with penalty equal to L) or must obey a 1-word command you give. [src]

Command Construct, Duration: L minutes. Target construct obeys your commands for the duration. You must be able to issue commands in a way the construct will understand: usually speaking the language of its creator works. Some constructs may understand telepathic commands too. [src]
Command Undead, Duration: L hours. Target undead creature obeys your commands for the duration. Intelligent undead get to save, with a penalty equal to L. [src]

Comprehend Language, Duration: L hrs, Range: self. You understand, speak, read, & write one language perfectly for the duration. You must have an example of the language present (eg a written sample or a speaker). [src]
Confession, Range: touch. Target must answer a question you give truthfully, or they take 1d6xL damage. [src]

Confusion, Duration: L rounds , Range: 60’. Target saves or is confused for the duration. On their turn, they roll 1d4; on (1), they act normally; on (2), they attack themselves with whatever is on hand; on (3) they attack the nearest creature, friend or foe; on (4) they do nothing but babble incoherently. [src]

Consecrate, Duration: 1 day. Takes 10 minutes to cast & requires 25sp worth of silver dust. You consecrate an area 60’ in diameter against the undead. Undead that enter the area take a penalty equal to L to all d20 rolls. If they have HD less than L, they are killed instantly. Undead can’t be created in the area, except by spells with more L invested than were used to cast Consecrate. [src]

Constricting Coils, Duration: L rounds, Range: 30’. A false serpent rises from the earth beneath the target, constricting the victim. Treat the serpent as having Strength equal to 1d6xL. The victim is grappled by the serpent & takes L damage each round. They can escape with a successful grapple roll or by dealing 1d6xL damage to the serpent, at which point in slinks back into the earth. [src]

Continual Flame, Duration: permanent, Range: touch. A heatless flame is created at the point you touch. It can only be put out by magical means. It illuminates an area of diameter equal to L x 10’. [src]

Corpse Lantern, Duration: L hours, Range: touch. Touch a corpse of human-size or smaller. It immediately begins to glow with a sickly light, & to float. It will drift after you for the spell’s duration, illuminating an area 10’ x L in diameter. [src]
Corrosive Touch, Range: touch. If you touch flesh, the target takes 1d6xL acid damage. If you touch an object subject to corrosion, it is damaged instead. [src]
Countless Eyes, Duration: L hours, Range: touch. Countless eyes sprout all over the target’s head. They can see through all the eyes at once. [src]

Create Armament, Duration: L hours, Range: self. A mundage weapon or suit of armour, of your choice, appears in your hand or in your vicinity. At the end of the duration, it dissolves into nothingness. [src]

Create Pit, Duration: L hours, Range: touch. A pit 1d6xL’ deep and 10’ in diameter appears at the point you touch. The sides are smooth and difficult to climb. Anything in the pit when the duration expires is summarily disgorged. [src]

Create Treasure Map, Range: touch. You must carve off a section of the skin from a corpse dead no more than 1 hour & cast this spell upon it. A map appears on the skin, guiding you to the location of L items or stashes of valuable that the creature knows about. [src]
Cure Mutation, Range: touch. Target loses L mutations. If they have multiple mutations, choose randomly which are removed. [src]
Cure Wounds, Range: touch. The target is healed for 1d6xL points of hit point damage. [src]
Darklight, Duration: L hours, Range: self. You are surrounded by an illuminating aura that only you can see. Illuminates an area of diameter L x 10’. [src]
Darkness, Duration: L hours, Range: 120’. Fills an area L x 10’ in diameter with total darkness. Light sources within the area are snuffed out. [src]
Death Knell, Duration: L rounds, Range: 60’. A creature with no more than L hit points remaining is killed instantly. You heal L damage. [src]

Deathless, Duration: L rounds, Range: touch. The target can’t be killed by hit point damage while the spell persists - their hp can be reduced to zero, but any blow that would kill them thereafter mysteriously misses or otherwise fails. [src]
Decollate, Duration: L days, Range: touch. The target can safely remove their own head. They can still see through their own eyes, & can move their body around as usual. [src]
Delectable, Duration: L minutes, Range: 5’+5’xL. The target appears so delectable that everyone in the vicinity wants desperately to eat it. [src]

Desecrate, Duration: 1 day. Takes 10 minutes to cast & requires 25sp worth of silver dust. You desecrate an area 60’ in diameter, increasing the power of undead within: they get +L to all d20 rolls, and any undead created in the area have +1 HD per L. [src]

Dimension Door, Range: 60’ + 30’xL. You step through an extradimensional door & emerge at a point you can see or clearly visualize. The passageway is open only for an instant, but with quick reflexes or foresight it is possible for others to move through it as well. [src]
Dispel Magic, Range: 30’. Removes one magical effect, or counters one magical spell, with invested L less than or equal to the L invested in this spell. [src]

Dominate, Duration: L days, Range: 60’. Target saves or is subjugated utterly to your will for the duration. Creatures with HD greater than L may save. Creatures with HD greater than or equal to Lx2 are immune. [src]

Dragon’s Breath, Duration: L rounds, Range: self. You can breathe fire for the duration. Each breath of fire deals 1d6xL fire damage in a 15’ cone. The horribly hot breath deals L fire damage to you each time it is used, if you’re not fire-resistant or something. [src]
Dream. Send a dream to any creature you have seen before & can name or clearly visualize (& which is capable of dreaming). The dream lasts up to 1d6xL minutes. [src]
Eagle Eye, Duration: L minutes. Creates a magical floating eye in the sky 200’ above you. It follows you around. You can look through it with the clarity of an eagle’s vision. [src]
Ear-Piercing Scream, Range: 30’ cone [src]
Creatures in the cone save or are struck deaf for 1d6xL rounds. They also take L damage thanks to ear-blasting pain. [src]

Ear Send, Duration: L minutes. Your ear detaches and flies away. You can’t see through it but you can still hear through it clearly, and you can telepathically direct it to fly up to Lx100’ away. When the duration expires, the ear teleports back to its proper place on your head. [src]
Earthquake, Duration: L rounds, Range: 10’xL. Affected area is subject to a violent earthquake for the duration: the ground shakes, stuff falls off shelves, people are knocked over. [src]

Ectoplasmic Hand, Duration: L minutes, Range: self. Your hand turns ectoplasmic. It can no longer interact with physical objects & creatures - in fact it passes right through them - but it can interact with incorporeal objects & creatures. [src]

Escape from Time, Duration: 1d6xL days, Range: self. You enter suspended animation for the spell’s duration. From your point of view, you fall asleep and wake up 1d6xL hours later; you don’t need to eat, sleep, breathe, etc. in the interim. If any harm comes to you during the duration, you wake up immediately. [src]
Enervation, Range: touch. Drain L levels from the creature touched. Creatures with HD more than Lx2 may save to resist. [src]
Enlarge, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Touched object or person doubles in size. An unwilling creature may save to resist. [src]
Entangle, Range: 60’. Plants in the area move to entangle and grapple the target. [src]

Eruptive Pustiles, Range: self. 1d6xL acidic pustules sprout on your body. Each time you are hit in melee, 1d6 of the pustules burst, spraying acid on everything within 5’ of you. Each pustule deals 1 point of damage. [src]
Ethereal Jaunt, Duration: L rounds, Range: self. You become incorporeal for the duration. [src]

Etheric Shards, Duration: L minutes, Range: 120’. An area 10’xL in diameter is filled with tiny shards of etheric matter. They drive into the flesh of anything that moves too quickly through the area: if a creature moves more than 5’ per round through the region, they take 1d4 damage per 5’ extra they move. [src]

Explode Corpse, Range: 15’ + 15’xL. All corpses in a radius of 60’ around the caster explode, dealing 1d6 damage per HD to victims within 10’. Corpses created by creatures with HD greater than L are unaffected. [src]
Faerie Fire, Duration: Lx5 rounds, Range: 120’. Target is outlined in bright light for the duration. [src]
False Life, Duration: L minutes, Range: self. You gain 1d6xL temporary hit points for the duration. You count as undead as long as these hit points persist. [src]
Feast of Ashes, Duration: L days , Range: 60’. Target experiences unassuageable hunger. They will not die, but feel as though they are starving; worse, eating food causes them horrible nausea. [src]
Feather Fall, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. The target falls slowly & lightly as long as the spell is active. They won’t take any damage from falling. [src]
Fester, Duration: 1 hour, Range: 30’. Any time the target recieves magical/alchemical healing, they must roll a d20 greater than or equal to 1d6xL or recieve no healing at all. [src]
Finger of Death, Range: 15’. Target saves. They take 1d6xL x 5 damage on failure, or 1d6xL damage on success. [src]
Fire of Judgement, Duration: L rounds, Range: 30’. Target takes 1d6xL fire damage each time they attack. [src]

Fire Snake, Duration: L rounds. Every time you move, you leave a trail of fire behind you. Anything adjacent to the fire takes 1d6xL/2 fire damage, and anything in the trail takes 1d6xL fire damage. The trail burns away 1d4 rounds after the spell ends. [src]
Fireball, Range: 120’. Blast of fire fills a 20’ radius sphere, dealing 1d6xL fire damage to everything within. [src]

Flaming Sphere, Duration: L rounds, Range: 30’. Summon a ball of fire, 5’ in diameter. You can use your action to direct its movement, up to 30’ per turn; otherwise it rolls 30’ in the direction it last moved. Anything the fire passes through burns, taking 1d6 damage/round. [src]

Flesh to Stone, Duration: L hours , Range: touch. The target saves or calcifies. Their maximum hit points are reduced by 1d6xL, and they take a penalty equal to L to any roll requiring agility or freedom of movement, such as attack rolls or Dex saves. If the spell reduces their hit points to zero, they are permanently turned into a stone statue. [src]

Floating Disc, Duration: L minutes. Creates a flat disc, 5’ + 5’xL in diameter, that levitates 5’ off the ground. It can support the weight of about 1 average human per L. You can move it laterally at will. [src]
Fly, Duration: L hours, Range: touch. Target can fly at a rate of Lx20’ per round. [src]
Fog Cloud, Duration: L minutes, Range: 120’. Summon a cloud of opaque fog with radius Lx10’. [src]
Force Mutation, Duration: permanent , Range: touch. Target gains a random mutation. You roll one mutation per L and choose which one to inflict. Unwilling creatures can save to resist. [src]

Frostfall, Duration: L rounds, Range: 120’. Affects an area 5’xL in diameter. A flurry of snow falls in the region for the duration, freezing everything within and making it impossible to see. Only works outside. At the end of the duration, the snow will be subject to the normal effects of temperature. [src]

Gaseous Form, Duration: L minutes, Range: self. Your body and equipment turns into gas. You can fit through very small spaces and fly at a speed of 20’ per round. You’re immune to most damage, but vulnerable to being blown around by strong winds. [src]
Ghost Mouth, Duration: L minutes, Range: 15’. You create an invisible mouth, which can gibber incoherent sounds at your will. [src]
Ghostbane Dirge, Duration: L minutes, Range: 60’. A haunting dirge emanates from your body. Corporeal weapons within the 60’ radius of the spell affect incorporeal creatures. [src]

Ghoul Touch, Duration: L rounds, Range: touch. Target saves or is paralyzed for the duration. Paralyzed victims emit a hideous stench that sickens anything within 15’ (-2 to all d20 rolls while nearby). [src]
Grease, Range: 30’. Summon a blob of slippery, flammable grease. Enough to cover one 5’ square per L. [src]
Hallucinatory Terrain, Duration: L hours. An area of terrain, up to 100 sq.ft. per L, appears to be a different type of terrain. Fine details are not possible. [src]
Halt Undead, Duration: L rounds, Range: 30’. Undead within 30’ of you are paralyzed for the duration. Intelligent undead get a save with a penalty equal to L. [src]
Haste, Duration: L rounds, Range: touch. Target moves twice as fast for the duration. [src]
Hold, Duration: L rounds, Range: 10’+10’xL. Target is paralyzed for the duration. [src]

Holy Smite, Duration: until death, Range: self. You indicate an undead/demonic/obviously evil creature you can see to be the target of your holy smite. Until that creature dies, you add +L to all attack and damage rolls against them. You can only smite one creature at a time. [src]

Ice Armour, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Target is encased in magical armour of ice. They are immune to cold damage, and the armour grants AC equivalent to chain-mail. If 1d6xL fire or heat damage is dealt to the armour, it melts away completely. [src]
Ice Spears, Range: 60’. L spears of ice burst from the ground at any point(s) within range that you designate. Each spear is 10’ long, and creatures struck by the spears take 1d6 cold damage. [src]
Illusory Double, Duration: L minutes. Creates an illusory duplicate of you, which acts as you direct (but can’t actually interact with anything). [src]
Incorporeal Chains, Duration: L rounds, Range: 120’. Chains grapple L incorporeal creatures with strength equal to 1d6xL. Has no effect on corporeal creatures. [src]
Inflict Wounds, Range: touch. Target you touch takes 1d6xL damage and saves or starts bleeding. [src]
Interplanetary Teleport. Teleport yourself and up to L willing others to a planet within L parsecs. [src]
Isolate, Duration: L minutes, Range: 120’. The target cannot be seen or heard by their allies for the duration. [src]
Jump, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. The target can jump up to L + 1 times their height for the duration. [src]

Levitate, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. The target levitates off the ground, like a balloon. You can move them up to 10’ up or down each round. They can move laterally by pushing against solid surfaces. [src]
Light, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Object you touch glows with light, illumating an area Lx10’ in diameter. [src]
Lightening, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Object’s weight is halved for the duration. [src]

Lightning Conductor, Duration: L minutes, Range: self. You absorb up to 1d6xL points of damage from electricity without harm. At any point during the duration, you can end the spell & release all the stored damage, affecting everything with 10’ of you. [src]

Lipstitch, Duration: L hours, Range: 30’. Target’s lips are sewn together. Their HD can’t be greater than the L invested. The victim can cut their lips open again, but they take L damage in the process. [src]

Locate Object, Range: L miles. You know the direction to an object - either a specific one that you visualize & have seen before, or an object of a type you designate. If no such object exists within the spell’s radius, you feel nothing. [src]
Lock Gaze, Duration: 1d6xL rounds. At the start of each turn, the target must save or is forced to hold your gaze. The spell is broken if you leave their line-of-sight. [src]
Longarm, Duration: L minutes. Your arms double in length. [src]
Mage Hand, Duration: L hours, Range: 30’+10’xL. You can lift and move objects weighing no more than L x 5 lbs within 30’. [src]

Magic Circle, Duration: L hours. You draw a circle with radius up to Lx5’ on the ground. You choose what type of creature the circle is against: good-aligned, evil-aligned, demonic, undead, or similar. You also state whether the circle prevents such creatures from entering or exiting. [src]

Magic Jar, Duration: L days, Range: 60’. You need an actual jar to cast this spell. The target saves, or their consciousness is transported into the jar, your consciousness is transported into their body, and your body becomes a useless husk. When the spell expires, everyeone’s consciousness goes back to its proper place. Can’t affect creatures with HD greater than L. [src]

Magic Missile, Range: 100’+50’xL. Fire one missile per L that deals 1d6 points of magical force damage to whatever it hits. You can direct each missile to a different target. The missiles never miss. [src]
Memory Lapse, Range: touch. Target forgets everything that happened in the last L rounds. [src]

Mirror Images, Duration: L minutes, Range: self. Creatures L duplicates of you, which overlap with you and confuse attackers. Any time you’re attacked, the attack has an equal chance to hit you or any of your images. If an image is hit, it is destroyed. [src]
Monkey Fish, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Target can climb like a monkey and swim like a fish. [src]
Paranoia, Duration: L rounds, Range: 120’. Target saves with penalty equal to L or considers all creatures their enemy for the duration. [src]
Passwall, Duration: 1 minute, Range: touch. Creates a magical opening in a wall, up to L x 5’ thick, large enough for a person to pass through. [src]
Polymorph, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Target is transformed into another type of creature. They can save if they wish. The polymorph form must be of a type you’ve seen before. [src]

Protection from Evil, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Target can’t be attacked or targeted with spells by inherently evil creatures, such as demons or undead. The spell is broken if the target attacks or casts a spell. Evil creatures with HD greater than 2xL can save to attempt to overcome this protection. [src]

Prying Eyes, Duration: L minutes. Creates L tiny flying eyes, which you can send out to scout for you. You can’t see through the eyes, but when they return you can absorb them into your body and recieve images of everything they saw. [src]

Rage, Duration: L rounds, Range: touch. Target flies into a rage (unwilling targets can save). They add +L to all attack and damage rolls for the duration, and must make a melee attack each round - if no other targets are available, they must attack themselves. [src]
Ray of Exhaustion, Range: 30’ + 15’xL. Target saves with penalty equal to L or is exhausted. [src]
Reduce, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Target halves in size. Unwilling creatures can save to resist. [src]

Remove Affliction, Range: touch. Cures one affliction - blindness, deafness, sickness, disease, poison, etc. If the affliction was caused by a spell, at least the same number of L must be invested to cure it. Otherwise, the number of L required should be based on the severity of the affliction. [src]

Replicating Ammunition, Duration: L rds, Range: touch. Touch a piece of ammunition. Whenever it leaves the quiver, a copy of it immediately appears where it was previously. The replicas vanish at the duration’s end. [src]
Resist Element, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Target absorbs up to 1d6xL points of damage of an elemental type you select (acid, cold, electricity, fire, etc). [src]
Restoration, Range: touch. Restores levels lost to level drain. You must spend L equal to the levels lost - you can’t cure them bit by bit. [src]

Resurrection, Range: touch. Dead creature is returned to life. They must have died within Lx10 minutes. If their HD was greater than L, they return to life with negative levels equal to the difference. [src]
Reveal Illusions, Range: 30’. Strips away all illusions within 30’ of you, unless more L were used in their casting than you invested in this spell. [src]
Reverse Gravity, Duration: L minutes, Range: 30’. Affects 10 sq.ft. per L. Gravity is reversed in the area. [src]

Sanctuary, Duration: L rounds , Range: touch. Target is protected by an invisible bubble of force for the duration. They can’t affect anything outside the bubble, and nothing outside the bubble can affect them. Unwilling creatures can save to resist. [src]

Sebaceous Twin, Duration: L rounds, Range: touch. A parasitic twin bursts from the victim’s midsection. At the start of round, they save or lose 1 Strength. Each time they recieve healing, extend the duration. Each time they take damage, reduce the duration by 1 round. If taking damage reduces the duration to zero, the twin is violently excised and the victim starts bleeding. [src]
See Invisible, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Target can see all invisible things, unless the invisiblity spell used more L than are invested in this spell. [src]
Shadow Step, Duration: L minutes, Range: self. During the spell’s duration, you can teleport from a shadow to any other shadow you can see. [src]

Share Senses, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. You and the creature you touch can freely exchange sensory information for the duration - ie they can see through your eyes, feel what you touch, smell what you smell, etc; and vice-versa. [src]
Silence, Duration: L minutes, Range: 20’ radius [src]
No sound can be emitted in the radius. [src]
Slow, Duration: L rounds, Range: 120’. Target moves at half speed for the duration. [src]
Slumber, Range: 60’. Up to 1d6xL HD of creatures in the radius save or fall asleep. [src]
Speak With Dead, Duration: L minutes. You can ask a dead creature up to L questions, and it will answer - though it is not obligated to be truthful. [src]
Spell Resistance, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. For the duration, any time a spell affects the target, the caster must roll d20 greater than or equal to 1d6xL or the spell has no effect. [src]
Steal Size, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. You double in size. The target halves in size. [src]

Stinking Cloud, Duration: L minutes, Range: 120’. Creates a cloud 20’ in diameter. Anything within the cloud saves each round or is horribly sickened - they take a -2 penalty to all rolls, and the sickness persists 1d4+1 rounds after they leave the cloud. [src]
Stone to Flesh, Range: touch. Heals 1d6xL points of petrification (see the Flesh to Stone spell). [src]
Stoneskin, Duration: L minutes, Range: touch. Target reduces all non-magical damage taken by 5 for the duration. They’re also immune to bleeding. [src]
Stunning Barrier, Duration: L rounds , Range: self. Any time a creature attacks you in melee, they must save (before rolling the attack) or be stunned for 1 round. [src]
Summon, Duration: L rounds, Range: 30’. Summon a creature you have seen before with HD up to L. It serves you for the duration. [src]
Suppress Curse, Duration: L hours, Range: touch. The target ignores the effects of a single curse of your choice for the spell’s duration. [src]
Swarm of Wasps, Duration: permanent [src]
Summon a swarm of wasps (about 10x1d6xL) in number). They won’t leave the approximate area in which they are summoned, but they ruthlessly harass anything within. [src]
Telepathic Link, Duration: L hours. Link up to L + 1 willing creatures to one another; they can communicate telepathically over any distance, so long as they’re on the same plane. [src]
Teleport, Range: L miles. Teleport to a place you have been before and can visualize. Alternately, you can specify a direction and a distance, but this is Not Recommended. [src]
True Form, Range: 120’. Removes polymorph effects. Effects with more L invested than are used in this spell are unaffected. [src]
Unwilling Shield, Duration: L rounds, Range: 120’. Any time you take damage, the target takes the same amount of damage. [src]

Vomit Twin, Duration: L rounds. You vomit up an oozy duplicate of yourself. Every time you move, you can choose to either have the ooze-twin follow you, or not. At any time during the duration, you can instantly switch places with the twin. The twin is destroyed if it takes 1d6xL damage. [src]

Wall of Fire, Duration: L rounds, Range: 60’. Creates a wall of fire, 10’ across per L, 10’ high and 5’ thick. Anything within 5’ of the wall takes L fire damage, and anything inside the wall takes 1d6xL fire damage. [src]
Wall of Force, Duration: L rounds, Range: 60’. Creates a wall, 10’ across per L, 10’ high and 5’ thick. Nothing can move through the wall, even incorporeal creatures, and it can’t be damaged. [src]

Wandering Flame, Duration: L rounds , Range: 30’. Flame embeds itself in the victim & they take 1d6xL fire damage. At the start of the next round, the flame leaps to a random creature within 30’, damaging them as well. This continues until no new victims are available or the spell expires. The caster & their allies are not immune! [src]
Water Breathing, Duration: L hours, Range: touch. Target can breathe underwater. [src]
Web, Duration: L rounds, Range: 120’. Fills an area 20’ in diameter with a sticky web, which entraps anything within, and sticks to anything trying to move across it. [src]
Zone of Truth, Duration: L minutes. You create an area 30’ in diameter, centred on you, in which nothing can knowingly lie. [src]
temperaments: Reckless. When you throw a weapon at a nearby target make an attack roll. If successful the weapon deals damage and falls to the floor. If it misses the weapon returns to you.
Frugal. You can turn a mangled corpse into d6 rations.
Vain. You can perfectly mimic the sound of another person's voice, or the call of a wild animal.
Miserable. You cannot be taken by surprise while you are awake.
Ambitious. You go first at the beginning of each combat round.
Merciful. Whenever you deal maximum damage with your weapon you may instead disarm/disable your opponent's primary weapon/appendage.
Indecisive. When you wake up from a good night's rest, you may swap any two stat bonuses. When you got to sleep, your bonuses switch back.
Gregarious. You gain advantage when holding your breath, avoiding noxious gasses, or screaming.
Deceitful. You may fight with two one-handed weapons. When you attack, roll damage for both weapons and take the highest result.
Paranoid. When you enter a new area the GM will inform you of the most likely way to die.
Stubborn. You may carry any amount of stuff. Each slot of stuff over your limit reduces your Armor by 2. It takes a round to empty each slot if you're in a hurry.
Blasphemous. Whenever you cast a spell, you may change the element (fireball to toxic-ball, etc).
Cowardly. Whenever you deal max damage with your weapon, you may instead push the target 10ft backward, and gain a free movement action.
Patient. Whenever you suffer damage, you may add that damage to your next successful attack.
Vengeful. When you kill an enemy, you may immediately make one additional attack against a nearby foe.
Honorable. Whenever you spend a turn to patch up an ally, they gain 5 hit points that last for the next hour, at which point the bandage comes off and they suffer 5 damage.
Aggressive. When you lead the charge into battle you act first in combat and draw the attention of all enemies for the first round.
Educated. It only takes you three days of study to learn a new language.
Manipulative. When you wake up roll a d20 and record the result. At any time during the day you may replace ANY d20 roll with that result.
Secretive. Whenever you sneak, you gain advantage, including the first attack you make from stealth.
Rational. You can go three days without eating rations, and suffer no consequences.
Braggart. You can jump twice as high as most people.
Resourceful. When you attempt to repair something and have the necessary materials, gain advantage.
Cautious. When you survey an area, you gain advantage to detecting structural weaknesses, secret rooms, hidden alcoves, and large traps.
Cruel. When you spend your turn snarling and screaming, all nearby foes at half or less health must make a CHA save or flee.
Condescending. When attacking an enemy lower then you (in height, or elevation) you gain advantage.
Eloquent. When you try to convince someone with a lie, you can pay coin to re-roll your saves. The price increases every time you fail.

Hysterical. When you kill an enemy with your Weapon, it can absorb their life force and expel it in an magical blast (d10 damage, as breath weapon). If the discharge deals 5 or more damage, you suffer 3 damage in the blowback.
Selfless. When you choose to spend your turn defending another, you may add your STR or DEX bonus to your Armor.
Lazy. When combat ends you may immediately collapse into a heap for 30 minutes and regain d6-2 HP.
Irascible. You gain advantage to all rolls involving fire (avoiding, starting, etc).
Stoic. You gain advantage to all rolls involving ice.
Nervous. You gain advantage to all rolls involving electricity.
Obscene. You gain advantage to all rolls involving poison.
Whiny. You gain advantage to all rolls involving water.
Foolish. You can safely sample unknown plants to determine their toxicity/uses.
Tolerant. You can eat rations and perishables long after they normally go bad.
Naive. You can always smell the nearest source of fresh water.
Hopeful. When you scavenge for ammunition you always find SOMETHING you can use; but attacking using makeshift ammo deal -1 damage.
Humble. When threatened you may elect to drop to the floor, increasing your Armor by +3. You must spend your next turn getting back up.
Arrogant. Gain advantage to rolls involving art, biology, music, economics, geology, history, philosophy, psychology, religion, sociology, writing.
Wise. After you take damage from a creature you gain advantage to your next attack against them.
Snobbish. You gain advantage to all rolls involving diplomacy, subterfuge, bribery, negotiation, law, and political nonsense.
Promiscious. Gain advantage to all rolls involving seduction, manipulation, scamming, intimidation, bluffing, etc.

Joyful. Gain advantage to all rolls involving dancing, singing, playacting, or any kind of entertainment. You can keep a crowd distracted for about an hour, or earn enough money in a few hours to take care of your basic needs.
Persistant. Gain advantage to all rolls involving navigation, wayfinding, scouting, etc.
Pious. When you challenge your destiny flip a coin. Heads, gain advantage on your next roll; tails gain disadvantage on your next roll.
Chaotic. When you have the means/materials to cause damage to a structure (door, room, house, forest) you always succeed...make an INT save to determine collateral damage.
Loyal. You deal +1 damage with your starting mundane weapon (NOT your Tempered Weapon).
Empathetic. When you look deep into someone's eyes, you know what they most desire.
Just. When fighting barehanded you deal d6 damage.
Forgetful. You have perfect memory of everything that has happened to you in the past week. Anything older than that is a bit fuzzy.
Shameless. Gain advantage when picking locks, burgling, disabling traps, stealing, etc.
Friendly. You can identify the six degrees of seperation between you and anyone.
Focused. When you attack with a ranged weapon you can hit things from twice as far as most people.
Bitter. At a moment's notice you can always produce a hidden blade (d4 damage, 1 hand, 0 slots).
Pessimistic. You can always choose to make an attack that reliably deals half damage.
Shy. You make very little noise, and if you move carefully you are completely silent.
Gluttonous. You can eat a slot's worth of items, and regurgitate them at will.
Addicted. For the first 4 hours after you satisfy your addiction you gain advantage on all rolls. If you go a day without indulging, all rolls suffer disadvantage.
Braggart. Once per day, when you attempt a risky or dangerous action, you may tell a brief story/lie about how you've done this before and gain advantage on your next roll.

Tyrannical. When you order an ally to do something they gain advantage if they follow your orders. If they succeed then you can continue issuing orders. If they fail then you can't boss anyone around for the rest of the day.
Gentle. If you have not attacked an enemy, then their attacks deal half damage to you.
Generous. When you give someone an item, they gain advantage the next time they use it. They cannot give it back.
Flippant. When reduced to exactly zero HP you can make a sarcastic quip and keep fighting/moving/running without penalty. But if you are ever reduced below 0 HP you are dead.
Prejudiced. When combat begins, pick a single foe. You gain advantage on rolls against them.
Gullible. If you mimic or duplicate someone's actions you gain advantage on any rolls involved.
Encouraging. After an ally fails an action, you may give them a supportive word and +1 on their next action.
Superficial. When combat begins, if your clothes are fine and clean, the first attack made against you deals no damage but ruins your clothes.
Sadistic. After you kill an enemy you regain 1 health.
Insecure. You deal +1 damage against all enemies that are taller than you.
Serene. When you wake up you gain the temperament of an ally. When you go to sleep, you become Serene once more.
Disciplined. The first time each day that you would lose access to a spell, you don't.
Righteous. If an ally has taken damage, you gain +1 armor for the rest of the fight.
Spontaneous. Once per day you can make a save using any stat you want.
